TypeSignature.Value: .class public interface auto ansi abstract Style

Docs.summary: Represents a single built-in or user-defined style.

remarks.para: The Style object includes style attributes (font, font style, paragraph spacing, and so on) as properties of the Style object. The Style object is a member of the collection. The Styles collection includes all the styles in the specified document.

Use Styles(), where is the style name, a constant or index number, to return a single Style object. You must exactly match the spelling and spacing of the style name, but not necessarily its capitalization.
The style index number represents the position of the style in the alphabetically sorted list of style names.
To apply a style to a range, paragraph, or multiple paragraphs, set the Style property to a user-defined or built-in style name.

Use the method to copy styles between documents and templates. Use the method to update the styles in the active document to match the style definitions in the attached template. Use the method to open a template as a document so that you can modify the template styles.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property Application As Application

Docs.summary: Returns a object that represents the Microsoft Word application.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool AutomaticallyUpdate { bool get(); void set(bool value); };

Docs.summary: True if the style is automatically redefined based on the selection. False if Microsoft Word prompts for confirmation before redefining the style based on the selection. Read/write Boolean.

remarks.para: A style can be redefined when it is applied to a selection that has the same style but different manual formatting.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::Object ^ BaseStyle { System::Object ^ get(); void set(System::Object ^ value); };

Docs.summary: Returns or sets an existing style on which you can base the formatting of another style. Read/write Object.

remarks.para: To set this property, specify either the local name of the base style, an integer or a constant, or an object that represents the base style.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property Microsoft::Office::Interop::Word::Borders ^ Borders { Microsoft::Office::Interop::Word::Borders ^ get(); void set(Microsoft::Office::Interop::Word::Borders ^ value); };

Docs.summary: Returns a collection that represents all the borders for the specified object.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property BuiltIn As Boolean
public: property bool BuiltIn { bool get(); };

Docs.summary: True if the specified object is one of the built-in styles or caption labels in Microsoft Word. Read-only Boolean.

remarks.para: You can specify built-in styles across all languages by using the constants or within a language by using the style name for the language version of Microsoft Word.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property Creator As Integer
public: property int Creator { int get(); };

Docs.summary: Returns a 32-bit integer that indicates the application in which the specified object was created. Read-only Integer.

remarks.para: If the object was created in Microsoft Word, this property returns the hexadecimal number 4D535744, which represents the string "MSWD." This value can also be represented by the constant wdCreatorCode.

The Creator property was primarily designed to be used on the Macintosh, where each application has a four-character creator code. For example, Microsoft Word has the creator code MSWD. For additional information about this property, consult the language reference Help included with Microsoft Office Macintosh Edition.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void Delete() runtime managed

Docs.summary: Deletes the specified object.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property Description As String
public: property System::String ^ Description { System::String ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Returns the description of the specified style. Read-only String.

remarks.para: For example, a typical description for the Heading 2 style might be "Normal + Font: Arial, 12 pt, Bold, Italic, Space Before 12 pt After 3 pt, KeepWithNext, Level 2."

MemberSignature.Value: public: property Microsoft::Office::Interop::Word::Font ^ Font { Microsoft::Office::Interop::Word::Font ^ get(); void set(Microsoft::Office::Interop::Word::Font ^ value); };

Docs.summary: Returns or sets a object that represents the character formatting of the specified object. Read/write Font.

remarks.para: To set this property, specify an expression that returns a Font object.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property Frame As Frame
public: property Microsoft::Office::Interop::Word::Frame ^ Frame { Microsoft::Office::Interop::Word::Frame ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Returns a object that represents the frame formatting for the specified style. Read-only.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool Hidden { bool get(); void set(bool value); };

Docs.summary: Reserved for internal use.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property InUse As Boolean
public: property bool InUse { bool get(); };

Docs.summary: True if the specified style is a built-in style that has been modified or applied in the document or a new style that has been created in the document. Read-only Boolean.

remarks.para: This property doesn't necessarily indicate whether the style is currently applied to any text in the document. For instance, if text that's been formatted with a style is deleted, the InUse property of the style remains True. For built-in styles that have never been used in the document, this property returns False.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property Microsoft::Office::Interop::Word::WdLanguageID LanguageID { Microsoft::Office::Interop::Word::WdLanguageID get(); void set(Microsoft::Office::Interop::Word::WdLanguageID value); };

Docs.summary: Returns or sets the language for the specified object. Read/write.

remarks.para: Can be any constant.
Some of the WdLanguageID constants may not be available to you, depending on the language support (U.S. English, for example) that you’ve selected or installed.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property Microsoft::Office::Interop::Word::WdLanguageID LanguageIDFarEast { Microsoft::Office::Interop::Word::WdLanguageID get(); void set(Microsoft::Office::Interop::Word::WdLanguageID value); };

Docs.summary: Returns or sets an East Asian language for the specified object.

remarks.para: Can be any constant.
This is the recommended way to return or set the language of East Asian text in a document created in an East Asian version of Microsoft Word.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property Linked As Boolean
public: property bool Linked { bool get(); };

Docs.summary: Returns or sets a Boolean that represents whether a style is a linked style that can be used for both paragraph and character formatting. Read-only.

remarks.para: True indicates that the Style Type option in the Modify Style dialog box is set to "Linked (paragraph and character)".

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::Object ^ LinkStyle { System::Object ^ get(); void set(System::Object ^ value); };

Docs.summary: Sets or returns an Object that represents a link between a paragraph and a character style. Read/write.

remarks.para: When a character style and a paragraph style are linked, the two styles take on the same character formatting.

MemberSignature.Value: public void LinkToListTemplate (Microsoft.Office.Interop.Word.ListTemplate ListTemplate, ref object ListLevelNumber);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void LinkToListTemplate([in]class Microsoft.Office.Interop.Word.ListTemplate ListTemplate, [in]object& ListLevelNumber) runtime managed

Docs.param: Required object. The list template that the style is to be linked to.
Optional Object. An integer corresponding to the list level that the style is to be linked to. If this argument is omitted, then the level of the style is used.
Docs.summary: Links the specified style to a list template so that the style's formatting can be applied to lists.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property ListLevelNumber As Integer
public: property int ListLevelNumber { int get(); };

Docs.summary: Returns the list level for the specified style. Read-only Integer.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property ListTemplate As ListTemplate

Docs.summary: Returns a object that represents the list formatting for the specified object.

remarks.para: A list template includes all the formatting that defines a particular list. Each of the seven formats (excluding None) found on each of the tabs in the Bullets and Numbering dialog box (Format menu) corresponds to a list template. Documents and templates can also contain collections of list templates.
If the first paragraph in the range for the ListFormat object is not formatted as a list, the ListTemplate property returns Nothing.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool Locked { bool get(); void set(bool value); };

Docs.summary: True if the specified style is locked.

MemberSignature.Value: Default Public Property NameLocal As String
public: property System::String ^ default { System::String ^ get(); void set(System::String ^ value); };

Docs.summary: Returns the name of a built-in style in the language of the user. Read/write String.

remarks.para: Setting this property renames a user-defined style or adds an alias to a built-in style.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::Object ^ NextParagraphStyle { System::Object ^ get(); void set(System::Object ^ value); };

Docs.summary: Returns or sets the style to be applied automatically to a new paragraph inserted after a paragraph formatted with the specified style. Read/write Object.

remarks.para: To set this property, specify either the local name of the next style, an integer or a constant, or an object that represents the next style.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property int NoProofing { int get(); void set(int value); };

Docs.summary: True if the spelling and grammar checker ignores text formatted with this style. Read/write Integer.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool NoSpaceBetweenParagraphsOfSameStyle { bool get(); void set(bool value); };

Docs.summary: True for Microsoft Word to remove spacing between paragraphs that are formatted using the same style. Read/write Boolean.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property Microsoft::Office::Interop::Word::ParagraphFormat ^ ParagraphFormat { Microsoft::Office::Interop::Word::ParagraphFormat ^ get(); void set(Microsoft::Office::Interop::Word::ParagraphFormat ^ value); };

Docs.summary: Returns or sets a object that represents the paragraph settings for the specified style. Read/write.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property Parent As Object
public: property System::Object ^ Parent { System::Object ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Returns an object that represents the parent object of the specified object.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property int Priority { int get(); void set(int value); };

Docs.summary: Returns or sets a Integer that represents the priority for sorting styles in the Styles task pane. Read/write.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool QuickStyle { bool get(); void set(bool value); };

Docs.summary: Returns or sets a Boolean that represents whether the style corresponds to an available quick style. Read/write.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property Shading As Shading
public: property Microsoft::Office::Interop::Word::Shading ^ Shading { Microsoft::Office::Interop::Word::Shading ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Returns a object that refers to the shading formatting for the specified object.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property Table As TableStyle

Docs.summary: Returns a object representing properties that can be applied to a table using a table style.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property Type As WdStyleType

Docs.summary: Returns the style type. Read-only .

remarks.para: WdStyleType can be one of the following constants:

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool UnhideWhenUsed { bool get(); void set(bool value); };

Docs.summary: Set True to clear the property when this style is used.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool Visibility { bool get(); void set(bool value); };

Docs.summary: Reserved for internal use.
